adrFormatAddress: 1621 St Nicholas Ave, New York, NY 10040-3331, USA

originalText.text: Your workers are lazy!!! I don’t see how I ask to buy a scratch ticket and because your worker had counted the tickets they didn’t want to sell me 1. I worked at a store that played lottery and selling someone a ticket after I counted them would not throw off my count as it was just 1 ticket that was purchased!!! That’s just laziness but what can I expect dealing with Dominicans (I’m Dominican just in case). GET BETTER WORKERS

originalText.text: Bad experience! Avoid this store. Went there to buy and it seems that some Puerto Rican dude that they hire is some criminal that recently came out of jail came out arguing with me because I was asking him questions about vodka brands. He seems to lack customer service and doesn't know how to answers questions politely to the customers. All he wants to do is use scare tactics if he believes that you are giving him a hard time serving you which is his job to do it. Owner should know about this guy. Not a nice way to treat a lady

originalText.text: Horrible customer service. The lady was so rude, I wished I didn't loosen my grip on my $10 dollar bill. I would of walked out and yelped with a bottle of wine from a more courteous establishment. Avoid this business at all costs. It's not worth feeling angry, when you just want to buy a wine for an anniversary.

originalText.text: While I've had a lot of luck in the past, finding what I wanted, Unfortunately the last two times I went, I wasn't able to find what I needed. It was Malibu, which isn't that uncommon. Nevertheless, they didn't have it in stock nor did they have anything that was comparable.

originalText.text: My go-to liquor store. They don't always have what I'm looking for but they always have something that meets my needs and prices are fair. Customer service is great - not too invasive and helpful when asked.
